intro: Noccaea revelieri, commonly known as the alpine penny-cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pinnately compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its seeds are small and often dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas. Noccaea revelieri is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
